programme.title: WW2 Price of Empire
programme.desc: History of the conflict, examining its lasting impact on the political powers that were involved, beginning with a look at 1939 and how different countries were drawn into the war.

programme.title: Auschwitz: The Nazis and the Final Solution
programme.desc: A look at how corruption became rife within the SS, with the money stolen from Jews finding its way into the pockets of the camp guards rather than funding the war effort. Many of the SS also enjoyed illicit sexual relationships with female prisoners. Meanwhile, Dr Mengele embarked on a gruesome series of experiments, using children as guinea pigs in his research into genetic inheritance.

programme.title: Auschwitz: The Nazis and the Final Solution
programme.desc: The events of 1944, when the death toll rose substantially. By this point, the Allies were aware of Auschwitz's purpose, and faced a difficult decision over what should be done about it. Plus, the story of the occupation of Hungary, revealing how Adolf Eichmann offered to spare a million Jews in return for certain services.

programme.title: Auschwitz: The Nazis and the Final Solution
programme.desc: The final episode examines the liberation of Auschwitz and other camps by the Soviet Red Army. However, freedom did not mean an end to the prisoners' suffering - many were mistreated by their liberators and thousands died for the want of medical treatment.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: An exploration of the world's most densely inhabited waters, where variations in temperature owing to the year-long cycle of the sun encourage a vast array of marine life, from seals and sharks in the winter, to lobster and salmon in the summer, dolphins in the autumn and the walking handfish in spring. Narrated by David Attenborough.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Veteran naturalist David Attenborough explores the fragile marine ecosystem of the coral reef, where all creatures, including the corals themselves, have to fight for survival. From tiny beginnings, the reef grows and develops over hundreds of years, providing support for innumerable animals - yet one storm can threaten the entire community.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: David Attenborough investigates the opportunities tides create for marine life, showing giant stingrays gliding on currents for a rest, South African sea snails surfing the waves in pursuit of a meal, crabs playing football on a beach, and bottlenose dolphins embarking on a dangerous game of catch. In the oceanic world each turn of the tide can mean life or death for its inhabitants.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Exploring the wealth of marine life that inhabits the ocean's edge, dealing with the dangers of an ever-shifting environment. David Attenborough observes nesting seabirds in east Russia, Patagonian killer whales, Newfoundland caplin fish, walruses, and Brazilian green turtles - which make their annual expedition to an island in the middle of the Atlantic to lay their eggs.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering

programme.title: Secrets of the Railways
programme.desc: Documentary looking at railroads constructed during history's most turbulent periods, now associated with some of mankind's ugliest deeds. Beginning with the Trans-Pyrenees Railway.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: Great Central Railway's Scott Manley takes a rainy busman's holiday working as a guard at Bury, while a team of volunteers in Wales try to keep the line clear of overgrown plants.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The story of America's Liberty Ships', which were produced in incredible numbers and became known as the Model T Fords of the ocean.

programme.title: Secrets of the Bible
programme.desc: Documentary offering an insight into some of the events in the Bible, beginning with the story of the Ten Plagues. In the Old Testament, the Book of Exodus describes the epic battle between the prophet Moses and Pharaoh. Experts offer various various explanations for the 10 plagues of Moses and the mass exodus of the Hebrew slaves out of Egypt, a story that is a cornerstone of the Jewish, Christian, and Muslim faiths.

programme.title: Secrets of the Bible
programme.desc: Investigating the Turin Shroud, which is a length of linen cloth that some believe bears the image of Jesus. Cameras follow the efforts of a scientist trying to prove whether the cloth truly is Christ's burial robe.

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: The people responsible for tracking down war criminals who had evaded capture, beginning with the US army task force in charge of locating German scientists.

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: The story of Hitler's personal secretary Martin Bormann and the efforts to track him down. With insufficient evidence to confirm the Nazi official's death, the International Military Tribunal at Nuremberg tried him in absentia during 1946 and eventually sentenced him to death. Despite extensive efforts, he was never found and was eventually presumed to have died in May 1945.

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: How the SAS War Crimes Investigation Team tried to pinpoint the location of Gestapo officers who were wanted for a host of atrocities.

programme.title: Africa
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores the vast and diverse continent, aiming to show its landscapes and wildlife as they have never been seen before. He begins in the Kalahari desert, Africa's south-west corner, where clever meerkats are outsmarted by a wily bird's use of mimicry, a solitary rhino is seen to exhibit previously unknown sociable behaviours, terrifying insects prey on baby birds and the rarest fish in the world is filmed for the first time. In the neighbouring Namib desert, which receives almost no rain, the competition for scant resources can be fierce, as proven by a ferocious fight for supremacy between two giraffes.

programme.title: Africa
programme.desc: David Attenborough continues his exploration of the continent in east Africa, which is a haven for life and supports a higher density of large mammals than anywhere else on Earth. From dense forests to snow-capped peaks, steamy swamps to endless savannah, it's also a land of unpredictable extremes, where creatures must adapt to survive. In Tanzania, a tiny lizard risks its life to eat flies from the face of a sleepy lion. The nesting habits of the 4ft shoebill are also captured on camera - the giant bird has two chicks, but due to sibling rivalry only one will survive. On the plains of Amboseli, a baby elephant is near to death in the drought, so its mother leaves the herd to stay with her offspring until the bitter end.

programme.title: Africa
programme.desc: David Attenborough looks at the varied creatures of the Congo rainforest, one of the most competitive habitats on Earth. A sweet-toothed chimpanzee uses a complex array of tools to access honey from a beehive, the elusive picathartes bird feeds unsuspecting frogs to its dinosaur-like chicks and a massive female python reveals her maternal side as she sunbathes to incubate her eggs. Tiny leaf-folding frogs battle it out kung fu style, and as darkness falls the forest elephants gather to face their rivals.

programme.title: Africa
programme.desc: David Attenborough describes some of the wildlife spectacles of southern Africa, starting out in a little-explored rainforest discovered less than a decade ago by scientists who spotted it on satellite maps. There, thousands of butterflies dance for the right to mate, while on a tiny island off Mozambique, green turtles emerge from eggs and begin a hazardous journey to the water - with pied crows and hungry crabs eager to get them. Cameras also capture one of the largest gatherings of great white sharks on the planet as 30 of the predators circle around a dead whale.

programme.title: Wild Africa
programme.desc: Documentary focusing the mountains of Africa, home to many rarely seen species. From the snow-covered peaks of Kilimanjaro to the Ethiopian Highlands where temperatures fall as low as -20C, wildlife continues to thrive, including the rat-catching wolves which revel in their rodent-infested territory and bone-smashing vultures with a taste for marrow. Unique habits and survival instincts are all on display as the unpredictability and numerous threats to mountain life are revealed.

programme.title: Wild Africa
programme.desc: The savannah's mixture of grassy plains and woodlands boast an array of wildlife, ranging from many species of big cat to herds of buffalo, wildebeest and gazelle. The programme explores the way animals and people have shaped these lands.

programme.title: Wild Africa
programme.desc: The wildlife of the African deserts, where rain may not fall for 10 years at a time. In spite of inhospitable conditions, a multitude of species survives in these arid landscapes, including cartwheeling spiders, camels, squirrels which use their tails as sunshades, and even crocodiles.

programme.title: Wild Africa
programme.desc: Fergal Keane narrates a documentary focusing on the abundant wildlife found along the continent's 29,000km coastline. Species exist in habitats as diverse as the icy waters of the Cape and the tropical climes of the Indian Ocean, leading to some bizarre variations in behaviour - seals eat birds and die of heatstroke, crabs climb trees and penguins live in deserts.

programme.title: Ocean Giants
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the lives of the planet's largest marine mammals and the secrets of their survival. Cameramen Doug Allan and Didier Noirot travel from the Indian Ocean to the Arctic seas, filming 200-ton blue whales and fighting humpbacks. The team also discovers that southern right whales possess a pair of one-ton testicles and reveals how Arctic bowheads can live to be more than 200 years old. Narrated by Stephen Fry.

programme.title: Ocean Giants
programme.desc: The documentary explores the intelligence of marine mammals, discovering just how smart whales and dolphins really are. Scientist Denise Herzing talks about the development of a two-way communication system between dolphins and humans in the Bahamas, while in Western Australia the creatures are filmed using a range of survival skills. In Mexico, grey whales seemingly empathise with humans, while the humpbacks of Alaska pool their talents to increase hunting success. Narrated by Stephen Fry.

programme.title: Ocean Giants
programme.desc: Stephen Fry narrates this documentary exploring the vocal ranges of marine mammals. Sperm whales produce clicks to locate giant squid two miles beneath the ocean surface, and narwhals use a similar technique to find breathing holes in Arctic ice floes. Bottlenose dolphins communicate with fishermen in Brazil, humpbacks offer haunting operatic performances and boto dolphins create bat-like ultrasonic calls to help find fish in the murky Amazon River.

programme.desc: Tony Robinson embarks on another expedition through some of Britain's most historic landscapes. Over four days, Tony heads out from the Victorian wool capital of Bradford and treks in a giant loop around what is now known as Bronte Country. From the birth of Charlotte, Emily, Anne and their brother Branwell in the suburb of Thornton, he traces their childhoods to the much-romanticised Bronte hub of Haworth, finding that the harsh reality of life in the 1820s was far removed from the fantasy world dreamed up by the children at their father's parsonage home.

programme.desc: Elizabeth visits Mr Collins once Charlotte has accepted his proposal of marriage and confides in Jane that she regards him as one of the stupidest men in England. programme.title: Pride and Prejudice
programme.desc: Rejected by Elizabeth, Darcy decides to return to Rosling Park - and resolves to reveal the truth about Wickham's character in a letter. Colin Firth, Jennifer Ehle, Alison Steadman, Benjamin Whitrow and Julia Sawalha star.

programme.title: Pride and Prejudice
programme.desc: Despite Miss Bingley's efforts to keep them apart, Darcy and Elizabeth's relationship grows more affectionate - until bad news arrives from Longbourn about Lydia and Wickham. Jane Austen adaptation, starring Jennifer Ehle, Colin Firth and Julia Sawalha.

programme.title: Pride and Prejudice
programme.desc: Wickham's elopement with Lydia makes Elizabeth see him for what he really is, while Bingley proposes to Jane - an offer she readily accepts. Colin Firth and Jennifer Ehle star.

programme.title: Jane Eyre
programme.desc: After fulfilling her dying aunt's last wishes, Jane returns to Thornfield Hall - only to find Mr Rochester is set to wed Blanche. While all seems well at first, a ghostly figure begins to torment Jane as the wedding day draws near. Drama, with Ruth Wilson and Toby Stephens.

programme.title: Jane Eyre
programme.desc: A clergyman and his two sisters take a heartbroken Jane under their wing after finding her alone and starving on the moors. Starring Ruth Wilson and Toby Stephens.

programme.desc: Domestic disharmony ensues for the Meldrews as a routine trip to the garden centre starts a trail of turmoil including a scowling snowman, a laughing policeman and a mysterious saboteur. programme.title: Father Brown

Elinor is disappointed to leave her old home after falling in love with Edward Ferrars, her sister-in-law's brother, but looks forward to a promised visit. Marianne quickly finds she has an admirer in Colonel Brandon but is swept of her feet by neighbour Willoughby.

Meanwhile, Elinor has a disappointing meeting with Edward, but the reasons for his distant behaviour become clear when Sir John's niece Lucy Steele entrusts her with a shocking secret.

programme.title: Sense and Sensibility

Crime drama, starring Kris Marshall, Danny John-Jules and Josephine Jobert, with guest appearances from Ardal O'Hanlon and Sally Bretton.

programme.desc: First in a two-part adaptation of Emily Bronte's classic tale. In 1815, Mr Earnshaw returns home from Liverpool with orphan Heathcliff, who befriends his daughter Cathy but is resented by his son Hindley. Upon his father's death 10 years later, Hindley inherits Wuthering Heights and forces Heathcliff to live in the stables, while Cathy must choose between a life of comfort and her love for Heathcliff. Tom Hardy, Charlotte Riley, Andrew Lincoln and Sarah Lancashire star.

programme.title: Wuthering Heights
programme.desc: Conclusion. Tormented by his love for Cathy, Heathcliff arrives at Thrushcross Grange the day after her wedding to Edgar. Tension mounts as the pair acknowledge their passion for one another, but when she falls pregnant with Edgar's child, Heathcliff leaves Gimmerton to marry Isabella. Tom Hardy, Charlotte Riley, Andrew Lincoln, Rosalind Halstead and Burn Gorman star in Emily Bronte's classic tale.

programme.desc: The owners of a Tuscan inn are sent a severed finger and a photo of their son. Convinced he has been kidnapped by the Mafia, their daughter hires Hetty while she and Robert are on holiday.

programme.desc: Boxing Day sees heavy snowfall covering the country and the adverse weather causes major disruption across Poplar as roads become blocked and pipes freeze meaning families have to queue outside for water from standpipes. Sister Julienne must inform a family about the death of their loved one and uncovers an uncomfortable truth, while Valerie helps an unmarried couple living in a caravan prepare for their baby, but unforeseen complications knock her confidence in her ability as a midwife. Guest starring Anita Dobson.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: The nuns and midwives move into their new premises following the explosion that wrecked the old Nonnatus House, and are joined by fresh arrival Sister Winifred - a kindly-but-naive young woman. Jenny becomes concerned about new mother Merle's mental state and the welfare of her baby, who isn't feeding properly. Dr Turner believes it could be something more serious - although the mystery is eventually solved by the last person anyone would have expected. Chummy is struggling to adjust to her new role as a housewife and mother, and organises an open day at the community centre. Jessica Raine, Stephen McGann and Miranda Hart star.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Trixie's feathers are ruffled when Jenny is promoted, but the new Acting Sister has more to worry about after a mother-to-be reveals the baby she is carrying was not fathered by her husband - and to complicate matters, the real father is black. Cynthia is inspired by a lecture on natural childbirth, convinced it will help an overly anxious patient, while Alec and his friends try to persuade Jenny to join them on a CND march. Jessica Raine, Helen George and Bryony Hannah star in the 1950s-set nursing drama.

programme.desc: A reluctant Brian enters an addiction centre run by monks to treat his alcoholism, but soon becomes bored and looks for a distraction. programme.title: Are You Being Served?
programme.desc: Mr Goldberg sets up an employment agency and tries to find new jobs for Mrs Slocombe and Mr Humphries. Classic comedy, starring Alfie Bass, Mollie Sugden and John Inman.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Judith goes away for the weekend, leaving Lionel and Jean with the house to themselves. Comedy about late-blossoming love, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Who's That with Barry and Glenda?
programme.desc: Truly jumps to the conclusion that Barry is up to no good after he is spotted acting suspiciously, but his real motive for being in the woods with a suitcase is unfathomable. Long-running comedy, staring Mike Grady, Frank Thornton and Peter Sallis.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The priest is stunned when he realises that the fugitive seeking sanctuary at St Mary's is Inspector Sullivan - and the man is wanted for murder. Fifties-set crime drama, starring Mark Williams, Tom Chambers and Sorcha Cusack.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.sub-title: In the Footsteps of a Killer
programme.desc: Another mystery for the cops on the Caribbean island of Saint Marie, where the sun shines all day and it seems half the residents are killers-in-waiting. However, it's all change for the team. Last week they waved goodbye to Humphrey Goodman. No one knows how Kris Marshall's character is bowing out of the show - will he walk off into the sunset with new love Martha, or will he meet a sticky end, like his predecessor Richard Poole (Ben Miller)? What we do know is that in his place is Ardal O'Hanlon as DI Jack Mooney, who first popped up in the two-part London special. His first Caribbean case sees the reopening of a seven-year-old murder when a tourist provides an alibi for the woman convicted of the crime.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The discovery of a Roman sword with traces of blood on it is linked to an unidentified, headless corpse found near Heathrow in March 2008. It leads the team members to a lock-up belonging to a bodybuilder called Mark Rix, who died of a suspected heart attack the same year, so they start looking for connections between the original murder and Rix's death. They are helped in their investigation by anthropologist Fiona Kennedy, for whom Dan begins to develop feelings - just as he is told his wife might be discharged from the secure hospital where she has spent the past several years. Tracy-Ann Obermann and Liz White guest star.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: A wealthy land-owner's wife is strangled to death and her body dumped in a reservoir. Taggart and his partner Livingstone become suspicious when they discover the dead woman's husband was last seen preparing to leave for Switzerland - and carrying a large sum of money. Guest starring Alan Cumming.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: The sexual tension between Evie and Lord Montford intensifies during a tour of the Palace of Westminster. Drama, starring Stella Gonet.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits the Winsford Walled Garden in Devon, to answer the owner's horticultural queries.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.desc: Rickie Haywood-Williams and Melvin Odoom host the final edition of the high-precision game show. This time, 'The Arc Angels' from Northampton take on Mr England, Mr Birmingham and Miss Basingstoke, known collectively as 'The Pageant People'. The two teams battle it out to hit a specific target number 'bang on' in a series of physical and mental challenges, and at the end of the contest, the most successful group could win up to 40,000

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Busy observing the sky in search of UFOs, Magoo accidentally finds himself wandering over to Fizz's house..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo, hunting for Pinkbeard's treasure, mistakes the park for an island. Fizz and Weasel are there, selling ice cream that never falls on the ground..

programme.title: Britain's Favourite Walks: Top 100
programme.desc: Julia Bradbury and Ore Oduba present a countdown of the UK's best loved walks, voted for by more than 8,000 enthusiasts. Featuring locations from the West Highland Way to the Ridgeway, and almost everywhere in between. Famous faces including Catherine Tyldesley, Adrian Edmondson, Katherine Kelly, Larry Lamb, Janet Street Porter and Robert Bathurst hit the trails to reveal their own favourite walks, which feature in the poll. They are joined by experts, nature aficionados and members of the public who provide an insight into the hikes, the history and the hidden stories behind the trails.

programme.title: Countrywise
programme.desc: The programme explores what makes this time of the year so special in Britain's countryside. Ben Fogle climbs Helvellyn with a man who battles the elements in the Lake District every day, while Paul Heiney views the Peak District from a glider and Liz Bonnin witnesses thousands of swans begin their journey from the fens of Cambridgeshire to their winter home in Russia.

programme.title: ITV Racing Live
programme.sub-title: Racing on STV: Live from Cheltenham
programme.desc: Ed Chamberlin presents coverage of the 1.25 888 Sport Dipper Novices' Steeple Chase from Cheltenham, which is followed by races at 2.00, 2.35 and 3.10. Plus, races from 1.40 and 3.10 at Musselburgh. With analysis from Mick Fitzgerald and Luke Harvey, reports by Alice Plunkett and Matt Chapman, and commentary from Richard Hoiles.

programme.title: You've Been Framed!
programme.desc: Harry Hill narrates a comical selection of mishaps filmed by viewers, including footage of a golfer being surprised by an alligator, a child being fired into a belfry, and a restaurant receiving an unexpected guest through their ceiling.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as contestants Paul, Josie, OJ and Barry pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: Catchphrase
programme.desc: Nicola, Chris and Elysia compete to guess the phrases hidden in animated clues, but only one of them will go through to the Super Catchphrase round for the chance to win 50,000

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: While Victoria is full of love for her new baby, Aaron is downbeat about the year ahead, and Liam is in denial.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Tracy wakes up naked and hungover, and realises she has cheated on Steve. As she and her latest flame row in the street, Amy approaches and realises with horror who her mum has spent that night with. There's a stand-off at the factory as the events of Christmas Day overshadow the new year.

programme.title: Bancroft
programme.desc: Promoted to Detective Chief Superintendent, Bancroft has professional success but at great personal cost. When a double murder brings an unexpected reunion, Elizabeth is forced onto the sidelines by Detective Superintendent Jake Harper. However, as new enemies emerge, old foes make their move. Thriller, starring Sarah Parish, David Avery, Charlotte Hope, Adam Long and Lee Boardman.

programme.title: The Hangover (2009)
programme.desc: Three men on a stag weekend in Las Vegas wake up after a night of heavy drinking and find they have not only misplaced the groom, but somehow gained a tiger and a baby. Unable to remember the details of the night before, they set about piecing the clues together in the hope of finding their missing friend. Comedy, starring Bradley Cooper, Ed Helms and Zach Galifianakis.

programme.title: Flying Scotsman with Robson Green
programme.desc: The presenter spends a year working with the team of engineers who have been commissioned to rebuild the most famous steam engine in the world. Starting in February, Robson is given the task of cutting off the front end of the Scotsman and welding on a whole piece, and sets out to Durham, where he discovers how the invention of the steam engine helped to change the world. After a year in the workshop, the iconic train is ready for its first test run, and Robson realises a lifelong dream and gets to ride on the footplate as it sets off.

programme.title: Tonight
programme.desc: It's estimated that three quarters of the things now bought in the United Kingdom are now paid for by card - with some businesses refusing to take cash altogether. As more banks and ATMs disappear from the streets, reporter Adnan Sarwar asks if the nation is on its way to becoming a cashless society.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Jai catches Al in the act, Leyla is unsure where she stands, and Moira is thrown into panic.

programme.title: Best Walks with a View with Julia Bradbury
programme.sub-title: Yorkshire Dales, The Malham Cove Walk
programme.desc: The presenter takes a circular walk around Malham in the Yorkshire Dales, taking in the magical Janet's Foss waterfall and the awe-inspiring Gordale Scar. The stunning limestone pavement at Malham Cove - with its spectacular views - is a recognised highlight for those taking on the much longer Pennine Way trail.

programme.title: Bancroft
programme.desc: As the murder evidence begins to build, Harper and the team are met with conflicting accounts. Meanwhile, Elizabeth finds herself taunted by one of the suspects and the trouble around the Kamara deal, forcing her to choose between her personal and professional loyalties. As the chief superintendent is deserted by her allies, she enters a dangerous game of cat and mouse. Crime thriller, starring Sarah Parish, David Avery and Charlotte Hope.

programme.title: Gino's Italian Escape
programme.desc: Gino's train journey takes him on a star-studded line-up of Tuscan cities. He begins in Pisa, famous for its leaning tower, and also home of the Vespa scooter, which gives the chef the ideal way to explore the city, before he hops back on the train toward the medieval city of Lucca, the birthplace of composer Puccini. Here, he meets master violin-maker Fabio and rustles up a vegetarian asparagus dish. His final stop is Florence, where he meets Cecilia, one of a network of local cooks keeping traditional recipes alive by opening up her kitchen to guests from all over the world.

programme.title: Bradley Walsh's Late Night Guest List
programme.desc: The host is joined by some of his celebrity friends who, as well as taking part in games, will help one contestant win their place on the best guest-lists in the world. programme.desc: Paddy McGuinness presents a one-off special of the dating game, hoping to help 30 single women who work in the emergency services find a date on the Isle of Fernandos. Entering the love lift are firefighter John, doctor Iman and paramedic Johnny.

programme.desc: A former disaster specialist comes out of retirement to help Virgil and Gordon cap a leaking gas reserve.

programme.title: Dare Master
programme.desc: Danny's dare is take to the wheel of a high-powered sports car, but can he drift it and avoid the forfeit?.

programme.title: Robozuna
programme.desc: Children's sci-fi fantasy series about 14-year-old orphan Ariston and his robot Mangle, fighting an evil empire together.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo thinks he's in a triathlon and takes Fizz's superhuman strength headband, which Fizz needs to beat the President at a thumb war.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: It's cold, the boiler is broken, and Mr. Bean has to get warm, fast..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: George wins tickets to the local stately home. It's not long before Dave and the rest of the Spuds find themselves lost in its maze..

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: The Tracy brothers and their friends at International Rescue set out to foil the nefarious plots of the evil Hood. An updated remake of the classic 1960s marionette adventure series, this time featuring computer-animated characters on live-action modeled sets. With the voices of Rosamund Pike, Kayvan Novak and Thomas Brodie-Sangster, with the original Parker - David Graham - returning to voice Lady Penelope's long-serving chauffeur.

programme.title: Craig of the Creek
programme.desc: Craig of the Creek follows a young boy and his two friends as they go on adventures in a world of untamed, kid-dominated wilderness in the creek.

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is joined in the kitchen by Tony Hadley of Spandau Ballet and award-winning chefs Michael Caines and Frances Atkins. With contributions from wine expert Oz Clarke and cupcake queen Melissa Morgan, who offers some tips on making vegan cakes.

programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: Lisa Faulkner makes chicken liver pate and homemade melba toast, while John Torode prepares a beef Wellington with dauphinoise potatoes and cauliflower cheese - with a difference.

programme.title: Nadia's Family Feasts
programme.desc: Nadia Sawalha and chef Mark Sergeant prepare a New Year feast, featuring a 'full Spanish' for breakfast, roasted poussin for lunch and a foolproof beef Wellington.

programme.title: Beautiful Baking with Juliet Sear
programme.desc: Juliet is joined by chef Merrilees Parker, who serves up a range of party food for New Year's Eve, including baby baked canape potatoes filled with smoked mackerel pate.

programme.title: Despicable Me 2 (2013)
programme.desc: A reformed criminal mastermind who has abandoned his wicked ways for a life of fatherhood and jam-making helps a secret agent to bring one of his fellow evil geniuses to justice. The villain in question has stolen a dangerous experimental serum with the power to turn harmless animals into ravening monsters. Animated comedy sequel, with the voices of Steve Carell and Kristen Wiig.

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as celebrity contestants Adam Garcia, Carol Decker, Holly Walsh and Rylan Clark-Neal pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds for charity. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts a celebrity edition of the game show, asking contestants James Jordan, Fiona Wade and Louis Walsh to 'see it and say it' as they try to guess the familiar phrases hidden in animated clues. After the first elimination, the two remaining players battle to reach the Super Catchphrase round, where one of them could win 50,000 for their chosen charity.

programme.title: The Masked Singer
programme.desc: Joel Dommett hosts the singing contest in which a celebrity panel and a studio audience must guess the famous faces performing behind elaborate costumes. In the first episode, Rita Ora, Jonathan Ross, Davina McCall and Ken Jeong make up the panel, trying to identify the performers inside a bee, a duck, a unicorn, a hedgehog, a butterfly and a chameleon.

programme.title: The Voice UK
programme.desc: Emma Willis hosts the spinning-chair singing contest, in which celebrity 'coaches' seek out the nation's best vocal talent. But there is a simple twist - with the four coaches selecting their teams through 'blind auditions', looks play no part in the selection process, meaning each singer is chosen on vocal ability alone. Meghan Trainor joins the show as the newest recruit to the judging panel, joining series regulars Olly Murs, Tom Jones and Will.i.am.

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?
programme.sub-title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire? Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson hosts a special celebrity edition of the big money quiz. In the first episode the contestants in the hot seat are Frank Skinner, Naga Munchetty and Martine McCutcheon, who compete to answer 15 questions correctly and win 1 million for their chosen charity.

programme.title: The Keith & Paddy Picture Show
programme.desc: Keith Lemon teams up with Paddy McGuinness to remake Steven Spielberg's 1993 dinosaur-based classic Jurassic Park. The duo are helped by Sian Gibson, Sally Phillips, George Potts, Shaun Ryder and Bernie Clifton to reimagine the story of genetically engineered dinosaurs that escape from an eccentric tycoon's safari park and go on the rampage.

programme.title: Who's Doing the Dishes?
programme.desc: Boxing promoter Kellie Maloney throws a dinner party for four strangers at her Essex home. Brian McFadden hosts the game show where diners try to guess the identity of a mystery host holding a dinner party in order to win a cash prize.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show

programme.title: Beautiful Baking with Juliet Sear
programme.desc: Juliet looks forward to a healthy new year, baking savoury breakfast muffins, granola protein bars and a plant-based cacti and succulents cake. TV's Dr Ranj Singh serves up a healthy five-vegetable lasagne, and Juliet meets a vegan cheese producer.

programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: With Christmas behind them, John Torode and Lisa Faulkner present some light and fresh recipes to kick off the new year. They start with home-made granola and stewed fruit, Lisa makes a one-pot vegetarian pasta dish and a spiced cod tray bake and John demonstrates pearl barley with an array of mushrooms.

programme.title: Nadia's Family Feasts
programme.desc: Nadia Sawalha is joined by chef Eran Tibi to dish up a family feast from the Middle East. The menu comprises an Israeli mezze of stuffed brick and sweet potato hummus for breakfast, mussakhan for lunch, Eran's aubergine, tomato and beef stew for dinner and Nadia's cigar baklava with cheat's pistachio ice cream for dessert.

programme.title: The Voice UK
programme.desc: Emma Willis hosts the spinning-chair singing contest, in which celebrity 'coaches' seek out the nation's best vocal talent. Meghan Trainor joins the show as the newest recruit to the judging panel, joining series regulars Olly Murs, Tom Jones and Will.i.am.

programme.title: The Masked Singer

In the first episode, Rita Ora, Jonathan Ross, Davina McCall and Ken Jeong make up the panel, trying to identify the performers inside a bee, a duck, a unicorn, a hedgehog, a butterfly and a chameleon.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as TV presenters Donna Air, Amanda Lamb, Sarah Greene and Dan Snow pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds for charity. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: Dancing on Ice
programme.desc: Following on from the launch show over Christmas, Phillip Schofield and Holly Willoughby host the start of the celebrity skating challenge, joined by judges Christopher Dean, Jayne Torvill, Ashley Banjo and new addition John 'Fabulous' Barrowman. This year's celebrities - six of whom will perform tonight - are Ben Hanlin, Caprice, Joe Swash, Kevin Kilbane, Libby Clegg, Lisa George, Lucrezia Millarini, Maura Higgins, Perri Kiely and Trisha Goddard and - in the show's first same-sex partnership - Ian 'H' Watkins. Michael Barrymore was due to compete, but a broken wrist has ruled him out, and he is replaced by Radzi Chinyanganya.

programme.title: The Masked Singer
programme.desc: Another six unknown celebrities battle it out in the singing contest that has taken other countries by storm. The mystery contestants are dressed head to toe in elaborate costumes designed to hide their identities, while the panel - Jonathan Ross, Davina McCall, Rita Ora and Ken Jeong - tries to guess who they are. By the end of the show, the second celebrity's identity will be revealed and they will be waving goodbye to the show. Joel Dommett hosts the proceedings.

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?
programme.sub-title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire? Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Actress-writer Ruth Jones, comedian and actor Johnny Vegas and boxing star David Haye take their turns at answering the 15 questions that could bag them 1million for their chosen charities. As always, if they get stuck, they have four lifelines to fall back on - Ask the Audience, 50/50, Phone a Friend and Ask the Host. Jeremy Clarkson asks the questions.

programme.title: The Hobbit: The Desolation of Smaug (2013)
programme.desc: The party of dwarves and their hobbit ally continue the quest to reclaim their lost kingdom, journeying through the forest home of ancestral enemy the elves and finally facing the dragon that drove them from their home. Meanwhile, Gandalf the wizard investigates the rise of a mysterious dark power. Part two of Peter Jackson's fantasy adventure trilogy based on JRR Tolkien's novel, starring Martin Freeman, Ian McKellen, Richard Armitage and Orlando Bloom.

programme.desc: Demolition man Lawrie helps clear out his friend Johnny's property, hoping to find treasure amidst the junk. Team-mate Jabba starts a big job demolishing a restaurant.

programme.title: Demolition Man
